revised_title: The Influence of Breeds, Management, and Local Conditions on the Fertility of Sheep
tldr: This study investigates the fertility rates of different sheep breeds and the impact of management practices and environmental factors on their reproductive success. The author finds that Suffolk sheep have the highest fertility rate, while Southdowns have the lowest. Factors such as the condition of the ewes and rams, the season, and local conditions all play a role in the fertility of a flock.
